programme.desc: 5/13. JK Galbraith examines WWI as an instrument for social change, looking especially at Lenin, who spent most of the war exiled in Switzerland urging soldiers to start a world revolution.

programme.title: The Age of Uncertainty
programme.desc: 6/13. From the elegant banks of 17th-century Amsterdam to the dark days of the Great Depression, JK Galbraith traces the history of money - its uses and abuses, successes and disasters.

programme.title: Pubs, Ponds and Power: The Story of the Village
programme.desc: Ben Robinson unlocks the ancient roots of the Northumberland village of Warkworth, discovering clues that point back almost 1,000 years to the Norman conquest.

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Age of Steam
programme.desc: 2/6. Fred Dibnah traces the development of steam power, from early colliery railways to the end of steam travel in Britain in the 1960s.

programme.title: Inside Classical: Halloween Tricks and Treats
programme.desc: Join Owain Wyn Evans for a thrilling concert from the BBC National Orchestra of Wales.

programme.title: Stolen: Catching the Art Thieves
programme.desc: 3/3. The 1994 theft of one of the world's most famous paintings, The Scream, and the hunt to get it back expose the depths to which criminals go to gain a get-out-of-jail card for murder.

programme.title: Call My Bluff
programme.desc: Robert Robinson hosts the word-based panel game. Team captains Frank Muir and Patrick Campbell are joined by guests Angela Rippon, Nerys Hughes, Peter Brough and Jonathan Miller.

programme.title: Face the Music
programme.desc: Joseph Cooper invites viewers to match their musical wits against Patricia Owen, John Julius Norwich and David Attenborough. With guest musician David Willcocks.

programme.title: Chelsea Hotel - Arena

programme.title: Francis Bacon - Arena
programme.desc: On the occasion of his 75th birthday, Francis Bacon talks with great candour to his friend of many years, the distinguished writer and critic David Sylvester. Contains some strong language.

programme.title: The Great Philosophers
programme.desc: 8/15. Bryan Magee and his guest, Sir Geoffrey Warnock, discuss the work of German philosopher Immanuel Kant (1724-1804).

programme.title: The Great Philosophers
programme.desc: 9/15. Bryan Magee and Peter Singer discuss the work of German philosophers Georg Wilhelm Friedrich Hegel (1770-1831) and Karl Marx (1818-1883). He is joined by Peter Singer.

programme.title: The Gunpowder Plot: Timewatch
programme.desc: Documentary that re-examines the attempt to blow up the Houses of Parliament in 1605. Computer graphics recreate the scene and show how close the plotters came to success.

programme.title: The Jet Set - Timeshift

programme.title: The Making of King Arthur
programme.desc: Simon Armitage traces the evolution of the Arthurian legend through the literature of the medieval age and reveals that King Arthur is not the great national hero we think he is.

programme.title: Leonora Carrington: The Lost Surrealist
programme.desc: Film about artist Leonora Carrington who worked alongside Max Ernst, Andre Breton and Pablo Picasso in Paris at the height of surrealism, yet lived out her days in Mexico City.

programme.title: Expedition Unknown
programme.desc: Plummer's Gold. Josh sets off to search for the lost fortune of a notorious Montana sheriff. During his investigation, Josh blows open a mine that's been sealed for over a century. S3, Ep1

programme.title: Alaska: Homestead Rescue
programme.desc: Where The Wild Wind Blows. A Colorado war veteran's family and stable of horses are ravaged by hurricane-force winds that make subsistence all but impossible. S5, Ep13

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: The Young Guns' claim is ravaged by a vast dust storm. Meanwhile, the Boulder Boys chase old leads and the Bushmen face a disaster fifteen metres underground. S3, Ep14

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: A summer storm sees the Young Guns race to save their only claim from a flood. And, former trucker Chris arrives in Lightning Ridge, desperate to make a fortune in opal. S3, Ep15

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Call Of A New Generation. A new generation braves the sea, forging unlikely alliances across the fleet. As high prices draw foreign boats, captains young and old band together. S19, Ep1

programme.title: New: Maine Cabin Masters
programme.desc: Sprucing Up Spruce Mountain. The publicly owned and operated Spruce Mountain Ski Lodge is in need of vital repairs in order to keep serving the community. S13, Ep15

programme.title: New: Maine Cabin Masters
programme.desc: Additions For Generations! Chase Morrill teams up with his brother, sister and best friend to save and transform abandoned cabins buried in the remote Maine woods. S13, Ep16

programme.desc: The Future Dunphys: When Phil takes Claire to the hospital for her angiogram, they meet a family who are basically their future selves. They're not sure they like what they see.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Procreation Calculation: Stuart starts bringing his new girlfriend home to Howard and Bernadette's house. Penny and Leonard talk about starting a family.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Tam Turbulence: When Sheldon won't tell anyone why he's never mentioned Tam, his childhood best friend, Leonard tries to find out more.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Planetarium Collision: Sheldon accidentally sabotages Amy's career. Raj isn't keen when Howard's invited to host a show with him at the planetarium.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Imitation Perturbation: Howard dresses up as Sheldon for Halloween, so Sheldon gets revenge. Leonard is shocked that Penny can't recall their first kiss.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Balancing: Jake and Amy create a system to balance work and childcare. Rosa gets a new house guest.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: PB&J: Jake and an old friend go for a ride, reminiscing about the old days.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Burger Kings: Mr Burns gets into the plant-based burger business. But Lisa is convinced that he has an ulterior motive.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Panic on the Streets of Springfield: Lisa develops an imaginary friendship with a morose British singer. Homer gets a powerful truck.

programme.title: Married at First Sight UK
programme.desc: Brand new series: At the final Commitment Ceremony, one bride faces up to some difficult truths, and the revelation of a scandal sends shockwaves through the group.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Stockholm Syndrome: Howard and Bernadette go on a trip without their children, Leonard and Penny try to keep a secret, and Raj makes a new friend.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: 24 Minutes: In a parody of the action series 24, Bart and Lisa must stop bullies releasing a stink bomb at school.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: You Kent Always Say What You Want: After spilling coffee on his lap, Kent Brockman swears on live TV and gets fired. So Kent and Lisa team up to broadcast inconvenient truths.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: With their families being torn apart, tensions rise between Darren and Diane. Gemma is pulled in all directions, but whose side will she choose? And Dodger receives some new evidence...

programme.title: New: MAFS UK Does Come Dine
programme.desc: with Me: Brand new series - Self-proclaimed icon Ella Morgan hosts a 'night of a thousand icons' with a decadent menu - that she's never cooked before! (Ep3/5)

programme.title: America's Next Top Model
programme.desc: Patricia Field: Iconic reality with Tyra Banks. Makeovers are tainted by a shock twist before the models pose as fallen angels. With guest judge Patricia Field.

programme.title: New: Married at First Sight UK
programme.desc: Brand new series: On their final dates, one couple discuss the long-distance dilemma... can it work? And an ill-chosen date venue sparks a rollercoaster of emotions for others.

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: On the box this time: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars, Holidaying with Jane McDonald, Open House: The Great Sex Experiment and Peaky Blinders.

programme.title: Deadpool 2
programme.desc: (2018) Ryan Reynolds returns as the potty-mouthed, can of whup-ass-opening superhero and now he's got buddies to help him take on baddie Josh Brolin in the all-out action comedy sequel.

programme.title: Good Boys
programme.desc: (2019) Coming-of-age comedy about three young boys embarking on a brand new, terrifying adventure: sixth grade. Girls, kissing and an epic four-mile journey await.

programme.title: Moneyboys
programme.desc: (2021) Gritty drama set in South China following the life of a male sex worker who must juggle the demands of his family, while keeping how he supports them a secret. In Mandarin/subs.

programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.desc: Comedy sketch show in BSL with a variety of characters, including a deaf man looking for love, a deaf spy and an interpreter. (Ep2)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Mandy
programme.desc: (1952) Poignant Ealing drama starring seven-year-old Mandy Miller as a deaf girl whose parents - played by Phyllis Calvert and Terence Morgan - fight over her treatment.

programme.title: Rio Grande
programme.desc: (1950) Western. John Wayne plays the commander of a Texan fort at which his ex-wife (Maureen O'Hara) pitches up. Can he win back her love by saving kidnapped children from Apache raiders?

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: (1954) Crime-comedy starring Alec Guinness. A priest is tasked with accompanying a priceless religious artifact from London to Rome. But the prolific thief Flambeau is hot on his trail...

programme.title: The Colditz Story
programme.desc: (1954) Classic Second World War drama. John Mills, Lionel Jeffries and Bryan Forbes star as just some of the POWs determined to break out of the infamous German 'escape-proof' prison.

programme.title: Starman
programme.desc: (1984) John Carpenter's sci-fi romance with Jeff Bridges and Karen Allen. An alien is stranded on Earth, where he assumes the form of a widow's dead husband - and finds the locals hostile.

programme.title: Where the Crawdads Sing
programme.desc: (2022) Daisy Edgar-Jones stars in director Olivia Newman's adaptation of Delia Owens' best-selling novel about a feral child who's accused of murder in America's Deep South. Did she do it?

programme.title: How I Live Now
programme.desc: (2012) Saoirse Ronan and George MacKay star in director Kevin Macdonald's romance-thriller about a US teen who falls in love just as Europe tips into war. Very strong language.

programme.title: Petite Maman
programme.desc: (2021) Mystical drama. Eight-year-old Nelly meets a young girl playing in the woods behind her dead grandmother's house. And they seem to have an awful lot in common... In French/subs.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Nicholas Nickleby
programme.desc: (1947) Drama with Derek Bond, based on Charles Dickens' novel. After his father dies, Nicholas seeks the help of his cold, avaricious, scheming uncle. Predictably, it doesn't go well.

programme.title: The Nevadan
programme.desc: (1950) Western with Randolph Scott and Dorothy Malone. A cunning US Marshal pretends to be a doofus to get a bank robber to take him to the hidden loot.

programme.title: The Bravados
programme.desc: (1958) Brooding western starring Joan Collins and Gregory Peck. A man hunts down the four escaped prisoners who he believes are responsible for the murder of his wife.

programme.title: The Winslow Boy
programme.desc: (1948) Anthony Asquith's drama based on a famous 1912 court case with Cedric Hardwicke as the father of a boy accused of theft who pursues the case to the highest courts. With Robert Donat.

programme.title: Made in Italy
programme.desc: (2020) Comedy-drama with Liam Neeson. An estranged father and son team up to fix up and sell an old Tuscan villa that their late wife and mother left to them.

programme.title: Copshop
programme.desc: (2021) Action thriller with Gerard Butler. A hitman gets himself arrested so that he can get to a bad guy, who also got himself arrested, so that he could hide from the hitman.

programme.title: Late Night with the Devil
programme.desc: (2023) Unsettling found-footage horror with David Dastmalchian. A has-been host tries to save his 70s talk show using a demonically possessed 13-year-old girl. Really, what could go wrong?

programme.title: The Vanishing
programme.desc: (2018) Gerard Butler and Peter Mullan star in Kristoffer Nyholm's tense thriller based on a true story. Three lighthouse keepers mysteriously disappear after finding a chest of gold bars.

programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Gideon of Scotland Yard
programme.desc: (1958) Drama. Jack Hawkins stars as Police Inspector Gideon, who faces outrage and danger in his quest to bring London's criminals to justice. With Anna Massey, John Loder and Cyril Cusack.

programme.title: Footsteps in the Fog
programme.desc: (1955) Atmospheric Victorian melodrama. Stewart Granger plays a sinister aristocrat who poisons his wife. However, his maid (Jean Simmons) knows his secret and tries to use it against him.

programme.title: Jubal
programme.desc: (1956) Western with Glenn Ford, Ernest Borgnine, Rod Steiger and Valerie French. A cowboy is given a job by a rancher, sparking lethal jealousy in a colleague and desire in the boss's wife.

programme.title: Gunman's Walk
programme.desc: (1958) Western. Van Heflin stars as a veteran frontiersman whose determination to mould his sons in his gun-totin' image backfires disastrously. With Tab Hunter and James Darren.

programme.title: Charlotte Gray
programme.desc: (2001) World War II thriller. Cate Blanchett stars as a secret agent sent to occupied France to aid the Resistance against the Nazis. But she has her own agenda. With Michael Gambon.

programme.title: The Transporter
programme.desc: (2002) Action-thriller starring Jason Statham. For a price, an underworld courier will deliver people or packages anywhere, no questions asked. But one job lands him in deep danger.

programme.title: Bob Trevino Likes It
